00020 /*****************************************************************************

00022   sc_except.h - Exception classes to be handled by SystemC.

00026   CHANGE LOG AT THE END OF THE FILE

00030 #ifndef SC_EXCEPT_H
00031 #define SC_EXCEPT_H
00032 
00033 #include <exception>
00034 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_cmnhdr.h"
00035 
00036 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(SC_WIN_DLL_WARN)
00037 # pragma warning(push)
00038 # pragma warning(disable:4275) // ignore missing std::exception DLL export
00039 #endif
00040 
00041 namespace sc_core {
00042 
00043 class sc_simcontext;
00044 class sc_process_b;
00045 class sc_method_process;
00046 class sc_thread_process;
00047 void sc_thread_cor_fn( void* arg );
00048 
00049 /*
00050  *  These classes are intentionally empty. Their raison d'etre is for
00051  *  the implementation of various SystemC throws.
00052  */
00053 
00054 class SC_API sc_user
00055 {
00056     /*EMPTY*/
00057 public:
00058     sc_user() {}
00059     sc_user( const sc_user& ) {}
00060 };
00061 
00062 class SC_API sc_halt
00063 {
00064 public:
00065     sc_halt() {}
00066     sc_halt( const sc_halt& ) {}
00067 };
00068 
00069 class SC_API sc_kill
00070 {
00071 public:
00072     sc_kill() {}
00073     sc_kill( const sc_kill& ) {}
00074 };
00075 
00076 class SC_API sc_unwind_exception : public std::exception
00077 {
00078     friend class sc_simcontext;
00079     friend class sc_process_b;
00080     friend class sc_method_process;
00081     friend class sc_thread_process;
00082     friend void sc_thread_cor_fn( void* arg );
00083 
00084   public:
00085     virtual bool is_reset() const { return m_is_reset; }
00086     virtual const char* what() const SC_NOEXCEPT_;
00087 
00088   public:
00089 
00090     // enable catch by value
00091     sc_unwind_exception( const sc_unwind_exception& );
00092     virtual ~sc_unwind_exception() SC_NOEXCEPT_;
00093 
00094   protected:
00095     explicit
00096     sc_unwind_exception( sc_process_b* target_p, bool is_reset = false );
00097 
00098     bool active() const;
00099     void clear()  const;
00100 
00101   private:
00102     // disabled
00103     sc_unwind_exception& operator=( const sc_unwind_exception& );
00104 
00105     mutable sc_process_b* m_proc_p;   // used to check, if caught by the kernel
00106     const   bool          m_is_reset; // true if this is an unwind of a reset
00107 
00108 };
00109 
00110 inline
00111 sc_unwind_exception::sc_unwind_exception( const sc_unwind_exception& that )
00112   : std::exception( that )
00113   , m_proc_p( that.m_proc_p )
00114   , m_is_reset( that.m_is_reset )
00115 {
00116     that.m_proc_p = 0; // move to new instance
00117 }
00118

00124 SC_API sc_report* sc_handle_exception();
